context_of_use: This use case allows both admins and customers to view and download reports for analysis and monitoring.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: Access to reports for personal analysis
admin: Ability to monitor business performance through sales reports
description: This use case enables customers and admins to view and download reports for analysis and monitoring purposes.
triggering_event: The user requests to view reports.
postconditions: The user successfully views and downloads the requested reports.
assumptions: The user has the necessary permissions to view reports.
requirements_met: The system shall allow users to view and download reports.
The system shall authenticate users before allowing access to reports.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of reports available for viewing.
main_flow: 1. customer/admin requests to view reports → System prompts for authentication.
2. customer/admin provides authentication credentials → System verifies credentials.
3. System grants access to reports → customer/admin views available reports.
4. customer/admin selects a report to download → System processes the download request.
5. System provides the report for download → customer/admin successfully downloads the report.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the user is not authenticated, the system redirects to the login page.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If authentication fails, the system displays an error message and prompts for re-entry of credentials.
